Amber_Dotson:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Amber Dotson | image = | birth_date = | origin = [[Garland, Texas]], United States | instrument = [[Vocals]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = [[Singing|Singer]] | years_active = 2004-present | label = [[Capitol Records|Capitol Nashville]] | associated_acts = [[George Strait]]
[[Travis Tritt]] | website = }} '''Amber Dotson''' (born in [[Garland, Texas]]{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p675686|pure_url=yes}} |title=Amber Dotson biography |accessdate=2008-06-14 |last=Leggett |first=Steve |work=[[Allmusic]]}}) is an American [[country music]] artist. Initially a songwriter for Sony/Tree Publishing, Dotson soon began singing demos as well. She also made an appearance on [[Travis Tritt]]'s 2004 album ''[[My Honky Tonk History]]'' as a background vocalist.{{cite AV media notes |title=My Honky Tonk History |others=Travis Tritt |year=2004 |publisher=[[Columbia Records]] Nashville |id=CK 92084}} [[George Strait]] heard some of the singer's demos, and asked her to join him on his 2005 tour, which also included [[Dierks Bentley]].{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/az/dotson__amber/bio.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080128184558/http://www.cmt.com/artists/az/dotson__amber/bio.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=January 28, 2008 |title=Amber Dotson biography |accessdate=2008-06-14 |work=[[Country Music Television]]}} Dotson was signed to [[Capitol Records]] Nashville in 2005, and although she released two singles for the label, she did not release an album. ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Single ! colspan="1"| Peak positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="65"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]] |- | rowspan="2"| 2005 ! scope="row"| "I'll Try Anything" | 59 |- ! scope="row"| "I Ain't Your Mama" | — |- | colspan="3" style="font-size:8pt"| "—" denotes releases that did not chart |- |} ===Music videos=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" ! Year ! style="width:12em;"| Video ! Director |- | rowspan="2"| 2005 ! scope="row"| "I'll Try Anything" | [[Peter Zavadil]] |- ! scope="row"| "I Ain't Your Mama" | [[Wes Edwards]] |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080719125733/http://www.amberdotson.com/ Amber Dotson official website] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dotson, Amber}} [[Category:American women country singers]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Texas]] [[Category:People from Garland, Texas]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Capitol Records artists]] [[Category:Country musicians from Texas]] [[Category:21st-century American women]]
